channel.title: SlideShows of the Day
channel.description: SlideShare feed for SlideShows of the Day

item.title: Elasitc Path Research - Consumer Software Buying Trends
item.description: Software publishers face the same threats that the music and media industry have been forced to accept, that consumers value their products but are no longer prepared to pay for them. Software publishers and retailers alike must find new ways of licensing their products that resonate with their consumers.
item.content:encoded: Software publishers face the same threats that the music and media industry have been forced to accept, that consumers value their products but are no longer prepared to pay for them. Software publishers and retailers alike must find new ways of licensing their products that resonate with their consumers.
item.author: Elasticpath@slideshare.net(Elasticpath)

media:content.media:description: Software publishers face the same threats that the music and media industry have been forced to accept, that consumers value their products but are no longer prepared to pay for them. Software publishers and retailers alike must find new ways of licensing their products that resonate with their consumers.

Software publishers and retailers alike must find new ways of licensing their products that resonate with their consumers.

item.title: Bill Gates’ presentation to the National Governors Association
item.description:
On February 28, 2011, Bill Gates spoke at the annual meeting of the National Governors Association. States today are grappling with budget deficits, while also confronting deep education deficits.
Over the last four decades, the per-student cost of running U.S. K-12 schools has more than doubled, while student achievement has remained flat, and other countries have raced ahead. In his presentation, Bill Gates encourages the nation&rsquo;s governors to &quot;flip the curve&quot; on how much we spend vs. how well students do in school.
item.content:encoded:
On February 28, 2011, Bill Gates spoke at the annual meeting of the National Governors Association. States today are grappling with budget deficits, while also confronting deep education deficits.

In his presentation, Bill Gates encourages the nation&rsquo;s governors to &quot;flip the curve&quot; on how much we spend vs. how well students do in school.

item.title: NoSQL Databases: Why, what and when
item.description: NoSQL databases get a lot of press coverage, but there seems to be a lot of confusion surrounding them, as in which situations they work better than a Relational Database, and how to choose one over another. This talk will give an overview of the NoSQL landscape and a classification for the different architectural categories, clarifying the base concepts and the terminology, and will provide a comparison of the features, the strengths and the drawbacks of the most popular projects (CouchDB, MongoDB, Riak, Redis, Membase, Neo4j, Cassandra, HBase, Hypertable).
item.content:encoded: NoSQL databases get a lot of press coverage, but there seems to be a lot of confusion surrounding them, as in which situations they work better than a Relational Database, and how to choose one over another. item.title: There’s Something About Mobile
item.description: A lot has been said and done about mobile lately. But what is it exactly that makes mobile so special? And how can advertisers leverage the uniqueness of mobile devices and deliver true added value to their customers? A presentation by Glenn Van Hoof and Nikolas Sterck for Arteveldehogeschool Gent.

item.title: Six Habits of SOCIAL Entrepreneurs
item.description: What makes some entrepreneurs succeed while others fail? Charles Tsai of Social Creatives argues that it all boils down to six best practices - or habits. These six are fundamental to creating positive change in today&rsquo;s world. (They also correspond to the letters in the word, SOCIAL.)
item.content:encoded: What makes some entrepreneurs succeed while others fail? Charles Tsai of Social Creatives argues that it all boils down to six best practices - or habits. item.title: Hugh Hefner, Sherlock Holmes & Indiana Jones: Making the Case for Mobile Intelligent Content
item.description:
There are 726 million 3G mobile phone subscribers. Yet most companies are not designing intelligent content for them. It&rsquo;s a huge opportunity. As part of a Keynote I gave at ICC 2011, I highlight three companies that are doing it well (SCVNGR, Flirt.com, and Shazam.com).
Come follow along as I highlight the reasons why you need to be developing intelligent content for mobile devices.
item.content:encoded:

Come follow along as I highlight the reasons why you need to be developing intelligent content for mobile devices.

item.title: Don’t Be A PowerPoint Felon
item.description:
A tongue-in-cheek presentation with 3 tips to avoid being a PowerPoint criminal.
These are slides from a humorous/informative speech I wrote for a recent Toastmasters meeting. I&rsquo;ve modified the presentation since then so that it can stand on its own.
Spanish Version (thanks to David Gomez): http://www.slideshare.net/mercadeobienpensado/no-sea-un-criminal-del-powerpoint
